I know we had a thread about this a while back but I will do a new one since Symbiote, Bassman, and Gamehuis bring up intresting comments.
 
 
Matthew, what you are advocating is outright Socialism. High taxes and onerous regulations do more harm than good.

 
 http://www.politicalcompass.org/questionnaire
 
 It all has to do with where my political compass is
 
 Your political compass
 Economic Left/Right: -6.88
 Social Libertarian/Authoritarian: -6.26
 
 Notice on the grid how far to the bottom and the left I am.

Here's me:
 
 Economic Left/Right: 5.75
 Social Libertarian/Authoritarian: -5.13

I wouldn't take the positions it allots as gospel, the main point of the site is to highlight the inadequacy of categorising people in terms of left vs right. This is because it uses a relatively small number of questions to assess your position, and the questions it asks guage stereotypical views .
 
 For example it categorises you as some kind of socialist/anarchist, but you have expressed that you would like to use the state to crush religion, and its unclear to me whether government prohibition of drugs and guns, border protection, and the prevention of racial or sexist language is also a part of your ideal program.
 
 (Or maybe you'll combine open borders with universal welfare and healthcare, now there's a recipe for success).
That's basically the problem with all these compasses. The people who make them categorize people based on their own views of how people answer the questions.

...Your political compass

 Social Libertarian/Authoritarian: 1.28 
 
 
 Like I said Matthew, Conservative on most issues, but fairly Liberal on some.
 
 Here's another example. In the Whistlestopper forum I frequent, there is a poster there called Green Lantern. He is just as Conservative as I am but with one notable exception we have routinely bumped heads on. Labor unions. So as we're trying to get you to understand, you cannot just lump people into either "Liberal" nor "Conservative".

 Anything with a plus is not liberal

Anything with a plus is not liberal

 He said he was conservative on most issues, but liberal on some. This doesn't mean that he shows up as a liberal on the compass. Rather it can be said that if he wasn't liberal on some issues he would be more authoritarian on the compass.

The political compass does tend to skew results toward the liberal-left end of things. I have had results between -8 and -10 on both axes (it varies a bit), but I doubt I'm the most left wing or liberal person around. On other forums, less US Republican dominated than this one, (mostly Brits from all parties) almost everyone comes out in the bottom left quadrant.
